EventStory.Body:
Q4 2016 Baidu Inc Earnings Call
Beijing Mar 4, 2017 (Thomson StreetEvents) -- Edited Brief of Baidu Inc earnings conference call or presentation Friday, February 24, 2017 at 1:00:00am GMT
TEXT version of Brief
CORPORATE PARTICIPANTS · Robin Li - Baidu Inc,Co-Founder, Chairman and CEO · Jennifer Li - Baidu Inc,CFO · Qi Lu - Baidu Inc,Group President and COO · Linda Sun - Baidu Inc,Senior Manager, Investor Relations
CONFERENCE CALL PARTICIPANTS · Eddie Leung - Merrill Lynch,Analyst · Chi Tsang - HSBC,Analyst · Alan Hellawell - Deutsche Bank,Analyst · Alex Yao - JPMorgan,Analyst · Juan Lin - 86Research,Analyst · Piyush Mubayi - Goldman Sachs,Analyst · Evan Zhou - Credit Suisse,Analyst · Alicia Yap - Citigroup,Analyst · Natalie Wu - CICC,Analyst · Ella Ji - China Renaissance,Analyst · Wendy Huang - Macquarie,Analyst · Thomas Chong - BOCI,Analyst
OVERVIEW Co. reported full-year 2016 total revenues of CNY70.5b and net income attributable to Co. of CNY11.6b. 4Q16 total revenues were CNY18.2b, net income attributable to Co. was CNY4.1b and basic and diluted earnings attributable to Co. per ADS were CNY11.43 and CNY11.40 respectively. Expects 1Q17 total revenues to be CNY16.48-17.03b.
FINANCIAL DATA 1. Full-year 2016 total revenues = CNY70.5b. 2. 4Q16 total revenues = CNY18.2b. 3. 2016 net income attributable to Co. = CNY11.6b. 4. 2016 non-GAAP net income attributable to Co. = CNY13.2b. 5. 4Q16 net income attributable to Co. = CNY4.1b. 6. 4Q16 non-GAAP net income attributable to Co. = CNY4.6b. 7. 4Q16 basic earnings attributable to Co. per ADS = CNY11.43. 8. 4Q16 diluted earnings attributable to Co. per ADS = CNY11.40. 9. 4Q16 diluted earnings attributable to Co. per ADS (excluding certain items) = CNY6.49. 10. 4Q16 non-GAAP diluted earnings per ADS = CNY13.23. 11. Full-year 2016 total revenue growth = approx. 6.3%. 12. 4Q16 YoverY total revenue decline = 2.6%. 13. 2016 CapEx = CNY4.2b. 14. 4Q16 CapEx = CNY1.2b. 15. 4Q16-end cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments = CNY89.8b. 16. 1Q17 total revenue guidance = CNY16.48-17.03b.
PRESENTATION SUMMARY - 4Q16 Business Review (R.L.)
1. Highlights: 1. 2016, busy year, in which Co. experienced significant breakthroughs and challenges as Co. transitioned into newest and most exciting stage of journey so far. 2. In 2016, began to see glimpses of AI revolutionizing Internet and traditional industry. 1. PC era and rise of mobile over past four or five years in rear-view mirror, Co. is now living and breathing era of artificial intelligence. 2. Believes AI is new electricity, which will transform industry after industry, [spawn] new applications and products that Co. has yet to even imagine and fundamentally change how users interact with technology. 3. AI represents enormous opportunity and Co. is primed to lead AI revolution in China due to years of investment and Co.'s position at intersection of Big Data, technology and search, as well as access to best R&D talent in China and globally. 1. To seize this opportunity, continuously shifted strategy, organization and resources to AI. 4. Continued to gain industry recognition. 1. On 02/24/17, MIT Technology Review singled out this recognition technology as one of the 2017 Top 10 breakthrough technologies with Co. as key player. 5. Launched last Sept., artificial intelligence platform, Baidu Brain, is already deployed across nearly all products, including Search, Newsfeed, Maps, Nuomi and PostBar to name a few. 1. With AI, able to better match and predict user intent and deliver results that are more relevant and more targeted. 2. By opening up Baidu Brain's APIs to Chinese developer community, leading charge to transform traditional businesses into AI-enabled one. 3. AI-driven initiatives like DuerOS supported by leading Chinese language voice recognition technology opens up new human digital interaction paradigm. 4. Announced DuerOS powered TV assistant in collaboration with Citic Guoan and DuerOS powered home robot named Little Fish, Xiaoyu Zaijia. 5. Recently completed acquisition of Raven Tech, smartphone hardware startup. 6. AI technology is even showing signs of best in human. 1. Last year, Deep Speech, voice recognition technology for search was just slightly better than human level voice recognition accuracy at 82%. 2. To-date, technology has further widened lead, performing at 86% accuracy. 7. In Dec., AI capabilities were showcased on popular Chinese television show, The Super Brain, where Co.'s Xiaodu robot competed in three mind-bending voice and image recognition challenges against human geniuses. 1. Xiaodu won two out of three challenges and tied for the third. 8. Beyond core platform, leadership in AI creates vast opportunities in areas like financial services, cloud and autonomous driving. 1. Co. is investing in these opportunities for long-term and attracted some of the best talent to drive this effort to creation. 9. In 2016, made tremendous effort to upgrade to search user experience to ensure that users have confidence in quality of content on platform. 1. To-date, has largely completed process of verifying ICP licenses and enterprise pension accounts for all customers. 2. In process of cleanup effort, some portion of customer base may not be able to meet stringent requirement and Co. may experience short-term reduction in number of online active customers. 3. Higher standard, healthy and good for platform. 4. Customers, who comply with stringent requirement, maybe able to enjoy higher volume of [leads] and even more attractive ROI and in turn spend more of their budget on Co.'s platform, be it through Search, Newsfeed or other AI powered products. 10. Untapped customer pool remains vast with Search, Newsfeed and other products selling both direct response and branded advertising to key accounts, small and medium enterprises and local merchants; valuable proposition to customers is highly compelling. 11. With hundreds of millions of users seeking and consuming content on Co. platform, content ecosystem is key focus for investment and innovation, in particular Newsfeed is exciting AI powered product that has seen fast user adoption over past several quarters. 1. Newsfeed complements search by bringing users fresh, tailored content creating virtuous circle of content push and pull. 12. Nearly half of mobile Co. version 7.3 and above users engage with Newsfeed on daily basis and spend on avg. twice as much time in app vs. users, who have yet to use Newsfeed. 1. Strong traction is encouraging. 2. Looks forward to adding new app features and further improving Newsfeed product. 2. Detailed Results: 1. Another key part of content ecosystem is Baidu Brain-powered open content platform Baijiahao, which Co. launched at end of Sept. 1. Baijiahao content distribution platform creates high quality content across media formats like images, text, videos, AR and VR, which Co. hosts and operates within ecosystem. 2. Content creators are eager to be part of Baijiahao platform due to vast user traffic and targeted matching of users to content. 3. Platform has shown rapid growth with over 200,000 content creators registered. 2. On customer front, Newsfeed is showing early signs of being natural incremental complement to Search. 1. Encouraged by momentum gained so far with users and customers. 2. Sees strong potential for Newsfeed to help expand customer pool and attract more large customers in verticals like retail and auto and more SME customers in verticals like education and local services. 3. Maps and Nuomi continue to support Search ecosystem by providing reach, local services content. 4. In 4Q16, Baidu Maps, Nuomi and Local Express added breadth and depth to point-of-interest database, bringing users direct access to over 2.4m merchants as of Dec.-end, which is 117% increase YoverY. 5. Looking to some of longer-term investment areas, made progress in autonomous driving initiative and demonstrated technology at World Internet Conference in Wuzhen this past Nov. 1. Over 200 attendees and journalists experienced Level 4 fully autonomous driving under real world conditions in fleet of 18 self-driving cars, powered by Baidu AutoBrain, AI platform for autonomous vehicles. 2. Teams in Beijing and US are making incredible progress on daily basis with accuracy of Co.'s vehicular recognition already about 90% and Baidu HD Mapping exceeding 90% accuracy with centimeter level precision. 6. Launched Baidu Cloud business in 2H16 and has been making solid progress in building out cloud product offering. 7. With AI, Big Data and cloud infrastructure at on core, Co. is able to provide customers with highly differentiated value proposition. 1. Co. helped Taiwan railway administration build out its intelligent logistics cloud platform by leveraging Co.'s cloud technology and real-time Big Data algorithm to help optimize customer storage, shipment and route plan. 2. Introduced advanced solutions like logistics navigation, image recognition and IoT offerings. 8. Customer feedback for cloud service has been positive and growth this year has been encouraging. 9. Financial services business continues to transform traditional financial services industry. 1. AI strength is crucial advantage for areas like credit risk management and matching customers with most appropriate product. 10. Baidu Wallet, which serves as user gateway to branch into other financial products, expanded its reach with activated user account, surpassing 100m as of end of 4Q vs. 90m as of end of 3Q. 11. With Co.'s innovative approach to financial services products, Co. is creating new supply and demand and processing new market, all the while helping to support growth of traditional industries like education, travel, home decoration and cosmetic surgery. 1. In education loans, continues to dominate with roughly 75% market share. 12. iQiyi performed well in [qtr. too] with revenue and rapid subscriber number ramping up nicely. 1. In Dec. 2016, according to iResearch, iQiyi's mobile app maintained its industry leadership with 125m daily active users, 480m monthly active users, [335b minutes] monthly user time. 2. iQiyi is important part of Co. content ecosystem. 1. Looks forward to supporting its further growth. 3. iQiyi has recently completed issuance of $1.5b convertible notes; of which Co. invested $300m. 13. Baidu Delivery grow rapidly, nearly doubling GMV YoverY. 1. Baidu Delivery's differentiated go-to-market strategy of choosing select attractive market combined with Co.'s technology-driven AI powered competitive advantage are helping to build sustainable business for long-term. 14. Greg Penner will step down from Board, having served as Board member since July 2004. 15. Qi Lu, new Group President and COO. 1. Qi has been appointed as new Director and Vice Chairman of Board of Directors. 3. Conclusion: 1. AI represents revolution in how humans and business interact with and benefit from technology. 2. China plus AI will be tremendous field of opportunity that Co. is well positioned to lead due to long track record of investment and innovation. 3. Looking ahead, will continue to [hire] expanding portfolio of AI-based technologies to ever-widening range of applications, where Co. strengthens its role as essential distributor of dynamic content on Chinese Internet from news, images to video, data and connected services.
4Q16 Financials (J.L.)
1. Highlights: 1. 2016, challenging year and busy year with proactive implementation of stringent customer requirements and compliance with new advertising law impacting revenue. 1. These efforts are necessary and will help Co. build better user experience and healthier, more robust platform. 2. Largely completed cleanup initiative in 4Q16 and believes most significant revenue impact is behind Co. 2. 4Q16 revenue resets revenue base. 1. Looks forward to 2017 as time of gradual recovery and growth. 3. Over past year, carefully reviewed strategy and business portfolio. 4. Mobile transition is behind Co. 5. Co. is at cusp of AI revolution. 6. Strategic focus, organization and resources have shifted increasingly towards AI. 1. Excited to execute on vision in this new era. 7. Given this strategic shift to capture opportunities in new AI era, [does not] believe metrics like mobile search MAU, mobile maps MAU, GMV and wallet user numbers are indicative of business performance. 1. This will be last qtr. that Co. will report that set of operating metrics. 8. Always seeks to be open and transparent. 9. In 2017, will continue to invest to build content and service ecosystem and execute on plan to capture AI opportunity in China. 10. Content continues to be important investment area as Co. continues to support iQiyi's growth, and build-out Baijiahao content platform to attract content and service partners. 1. Maps and Nuomi and key relationships with partners like Ctrip will support service ecosystem. 2. Financials: 1. Note: 1. All number amounts are in RMB unless stated otherwise. 2. Total Revenues: 1. 4Q16 CNY18.2b, 2.6% decrease from 4Q15, and flat YoverY, excluding Qunar in 4Q15. 2. Full-year 2016 CNY70.5b, approx. 6.3% increase from 2015 and 12% YoverY increase excluding Qunar. 3. During 4Q16, had approx. 552,000 (sic - see Press Release "452,000") active online marketing customers, 18.6% decrease from 4Q15 and 13.7% decrease from previous qtr. 4. 4Q16 revenue per online marketing customer CNY35,400, 14.2% increase from 4Q15. 1. Up 13.1% from 3Q16. 5. 4Q16 traffic acquisition cost as a component of cost of revenue CNY2.6b or 14.5% of total revenues, vs. 14.0% in 4Q15 and 14.2% in 3Q16. 1. Full-year 2016 TAC as a percent of revenue, 14.7%, up from 13.3% for 2015. 6. 4Q16 bandwidth and depreciation costs as a percent of revenue, 6.8% and 4.5% respectively vs. 5.4% and 3.7% in corresponding period in 2015. 1. 2016 bandwidth and depreciation costs as a percent of revenue increased to 6.7% and 4.4% from 5.6% and 3.9% respectively in 2015. 7. 4Q16 operational costs as a component of cost of revenue CNY1.2b, representing 6.5% of total revenues, vs. 6.3% in 4Q15. 1. 2016 total operational costs CNY4.4b, representing 6.3% of total revenues, vs. 5.8% in 2015. 8. 4Q16 content costs as a component of cost of revenue CNY2.6b, representing 14.1% of total revenues, vs. 7.4% in 4Q15. 1. 2016 total content costs CNY7.9b, representing 11.0% of total revenue, vs. 5.6% in 2015. 1. Increase, mainly due to iQiyi's increased content costs. 2. In 2017, expects content costs to step up at a similar pace as 2016. 3. Content costs will be used to invest in high-quality licensed and self-produced content to support iQiyi and support Search and Newsfeed products through Baijiahao platform. 9. SG&A Expenses: 1. 4Q16 CNY3.3b, decrease of 26.4% YoverY and decrease of 22.0% excluding Qunar over 4Q15. 1. Decrease, mainly due to decrease in promotional spending for transaction services. 2. 2016 CNY15.1b, 11.7% decrease from 2015, and 5.6% YoverY increase excluding Qunar. 3. In 2017, SG&A will remain at a similar level to that of 2016 with spending shifting to mobile Baidu and Newsfeed to further drive user adoption. 10. R&D Expenses: 1. 4Q16 CNY3b, 19.5% increase over 4Q15 and YoverY increase of 25% excluding Qunar in 4Q15. 2. 2016 CNY10.2b, 0.2% decrease from 2015 and 12.5% YoverY increase excluding Qunar. 3. In 2017, will continue to invest in R&D. 11. Share-based Compensation Expenses: 1. Which were allocated to related operating costs and expense line items, increased in aggregate to CNY632m in 4Q from CNY341m in corresponding period in 2015. 2. 2016 up 27% over 2015 level and increased 60% YoverY excluding Qunar. 3. Other Metrics: 1. Operating Profit: 1. 4Q16 CNY2.2b, 38.2% decrease over 4Q15 and decrease of 40% after excluding Qunar impact in 4Q15. 2. 2016 decreased 14% from 2015 and 25% YoverY excluding Qunar. 2. Other Income, Net: 1. 4Q16 CNY1.8b, which mainly consisted of investment gain recognized as a result of Co.'s exchange of Uber China shares with Didi. 2. Other income, net was CNY24b in 4Q15, which mainly consisted of investment gain as a result of Co.'s exchange of Qunar shares with Ctrip. 3. 2016, CNY3.8b vs. CNY24.7b in 2015. 3. Income Tax Expense: 1. 4Q16 CNY401m. 4. Effective Tax Rate: 1. 4Q16 8.9% vs. 12.7% in 4Q15. 1. Decrease was due to newly granted preferential tax licenses for certain PRC subsidiaries. 2. 2016 20.1% vs. 14.4% in 2015. 1. Excluding share exchange transactions impact for past two years, effective tax rate was flat YoverY. 3. 2017 guidance, in mid to high teens. 5. 4Q16: 1. Net income attributable to Co. CNY4.1b. 2. Basic and diluted earnings attributable to Co. per ADS CNY11.43 and CNY11.40 respectively. 3. Diluted earnings attributable to Co. per ADS, excluding net gain recognized as a result of Co.'s exchange of Uber China shares with Didi, CNY6.49. 4. Diluted earnings attributable to Co. per ADS, excluding net gain recognized as a result of Co.'s exchange of Qunar shares with Ctrip for 4Q15 were CNY7.61. 6. 2016 net income attributable to Co. CNY11.6b. 7. 4Q16: 1. Non-GAAP net income attributable to Co. CNY4.6b. 2. Non-GAAP diluted earnings per ADS CNY13.23. 8. 2016 non-GAAP net income attributable to Co. CNY13.2b. 9. 4Q16-end cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments CNY89.8b. 10. 4Q16 net operating cash inflow and CapEx were CNY8b and CNY1.2b respectively. 1. 2016 net operating cash inflow and CapEx were CNY22.3b and CNY4.2b respectively. 11. Total headcount on consolidated basis, including invested entities, as of 12/31/16 about 45,900, up 2.3% vs. end of last qtr. 4. 1Q17 Guidance: 1. Total revenues CNY16.48-17.03b, 4.2-7.6% YoverY increase or negative 9.5% to negative 6.5% QoverQ. 1. Forecast reflects current and preliminary view, which is subject to change.
QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS Operator [1] Thank you. (Operator Instructions). Our first question comes from the line of Eddie Leung from Merrill Lynch. Please go ahead.
Eddie Leung, Merrill Lynch - Analyst [2] Good morning, thank you for taking my questions. And many congratulations in bringing Qi to the team as well. I have a question on Newsfeed. I think Robin mentioned that so far you've been seeing some complementary results between search and Newsfeed. Could you share more color with us on how your marketing clients are looking at these two applications, how they are allocating their budgets between Search and Newsfeed? Should we also see a bit of cannibalization to some clients as well? Thanks.
Robin Li, Baidu Inc - Co-Founder, Chairman and CEO [3] Eddie, this is Robin. I think when we say that Newsfeed is complementary to search and will bring incremental traffic and revenue to Baidu, it really means that many of our marketing clients, especially when I mentioned large clients in the industries of auto and real estate, they were not able to find enough number of queries or traffic to show their ads in the search context, but it's much easier for them to find targeted users in the Newsfeed context. And similarly, for providers of local services or education services that have a local focus, it's again easier to use Newsfeed to target their customers instead of using search. So, our customers or advertisers can actually find more qualified traffic on the Baidu platform. Currently, we've seen a very good adoption rate. Many of the marketing clients, are already coming up with specially created for the Newsfeed context, which is a very encouraging sign, that they embrace and like our Newsfeed product. And as I mentioned many times before, I think our business is very much traffic-bound, not budget-bound. So the more traffic we can provide to our advertisers, they will have more budget to match with this.
Operator [4] Thank you. Our next question comes from the line of Chi Tsang from HSBC. Please go ahead.
Chi Tsang, HSBC - Analyst [5] Good morning, good evening. Thank you so much for taking my questions. I also want to congratulate you on hiring Dr. Qi Lu, as well as ending 2016 and putting it behind us. I wanted to ask you a little bit about strategy and also about core search. In particular, I was wondering if you could give us a little bit more details on some of the strategic imperatives you might put in place over the next few years and what that game plan might be. And relatedly, I'm wondering if you can give us your current thinking on the importance of O2O? And then on core search, you're guiding to about 6% revenue growth in the first quarter. I'm wondering what that might indicate for search revenue, and also if you can give us some color on just the pace of the recovery of the core search business this year, that'd be very helpful. Thank you very much.
Robin Li, Baidu Inc - Co-Founder, Chairman and CEO [6] Chi, I'll give you a bigger picture on the core business and new opportunities and I'll let Jennifer address the Q1 growth guidance. I think we have entered the era of artificial intelligence, and fortunately we have invested in this area for the past five to six years. Actually, both the existing core business of Baidu and the new opportunities we are addressing are powered by AI today, especially for search. Five, ten years ago, when you think about search technology, it was very different. It's basically statistic-based technology. Today, search is almost all about machine learning, natural language understanding. So it's all about search. And people will be able to express their interest or queries in a much more natural way and we support voice as well as image as queries, and we've seen an increasing number of people using this kind of new form of queries to find what they need, which are all AI-based technologies. And Newsfeed again is also pretty much AI. Essentially, it's a technology that matches user interest with relevant content. So we find we can leverage our strength in AI technology to come up with much better products for our users. O2O, again, we reduced the subsidies as well as marketing costs for Nuomi and Baidu Deliveries, but we think this is an integral part of our core business. People come to Baidu search for all kinds of things, including information, content and services. And Nuomi provides the perfect content for services. And we are fine-tuning the Nuomi content as well as services and making them friendlier to the Mobile Baidu users and making more opportunities for Nuomi merchants to show up in the Mobile Baidu platform. So, going forward, we think we will be able to see solid growth in both our core products, which now include search, Newsfeed, O2O, and also new initiatives in terms of cloud, financial services, autonomous driving, and a few other AI-related initiatives.
Jennifer Li, Baidu Inc - CFO [7] And Chi, as you recall, last year was a busy year, lots of activity, particularly related to addressing the customer base, happened in the middle of the second quarter. So as we look at 2017, I think, thinking about 2016 was not a very normal year. Maybe looking and thinking about the revenues pattern from a sequential quarter-over-quarter perspective would be more meaningful. And that I think is perhaps an easier way to think about the revenue growth. As I mentioned earlier, Q4 largely resets our revenue base, particularly for search business. Much of the cleanup activities, the higher requirements for our customers are put in place, and the revenue impact, as a result, is largely behind us. So as we're going into Q1 and for the rest of the year, I think the search - we have been carrying out this business for years and it does have its quarterly patterns. And thinking it in that way as a normal pattern, maybe that's a helpful way to think about the business this year. And this year, as we are looking towards gradually recovering and we'll drive growth in the search business, of course other than search we have the feed product that is complementary to the core search business, so that's perhaps helpful as you think about the 2017 revenue growth.
Operator [8] Thank you. Our next question comes from the line of Alan Hellawell from Deutsche Bank. Please go ahead.
Alan Hellawell, Deutsche Bank - Analyst [9] Thank you very much. And yes, I just want to join the chorus of congratulations with the senior management changes. Just with regard to iQiyi, if I'm not mistaken, we talked about a 110% growth in content cost last year and I believe Jennifer said we should expect a similar degree of growth, and I assume that's a percentage statement. And if so, would that suggest that there's a further expansion in loss margin or are there things going on in revenues that would somehow lessen that negative contribution? And then secondly, I was just curious, how would we view the margin profile of Newsfeed versus core search both in these early days -- and then, where would they be on a steady state basis? I assume you have content-related expenses associated with procuring news flow. So I was just curious how those two margins might compare. Thank you very much.
Jennifer Li, Baidu Inc - CFO [10] Hi, Alan. Yes, as I indicated earlier, content investment will continue to be an important investment area for us going into 2017. For iQiyi, over the past two years, we have invested strategically and very successfully in iQiyi's content. And as you can see, iQiyi's subscription user base is growing, and that nicely complements its advertising revenue business model. So I think going into 2017, we'll continue to execute on that strategy. iQiyi has demonstrated over the years a high competency in quality content selection. And going into 2017, more of the effort will be spent in self-produced content, and that will help further strengthen and expand our subscription user base. From a margin perspective for iQiyi, over the past two years, their margin is actually improving, and we expect that will be the trend going forward. So iQiyi is on a solid path and I think the investment is very warranted, and they have demonstrated good returns for those kinds of content investment. I included in 2017 content, as you mentioned, you have correctly pointed out that we also invest in content for our feed business. The feed business product, from a margin profile perspective, is different from search. Related at this early stage, part of the investment for feed is content related, and also we will be aggressive in rolling out user adoption mechanisms for feed to be more penetrated into the user base. So in early stage, you know, monetization may be ramping up, but at the same time we're investing in distribution channels, in sales and marketing, as well as content for feed. Over time, as we mentioned earlier, this is also an integral part of our search service and that offers a bigger product selection for our advertiser customers and also, very importantly, offers more ad inventory if our users' adoption is good. So, early stage for feed but it does carry a slightly different margin profile, but overall it's complementary and enhancive to our search service.
Operator [11] Thank you. Our next question comes from the line of Alicia Yap from Citigroup. Please go ahead.
Alicia Yap, Citigroup - Analyst [12] Thank you. Good morning, Robin, Jennifer and Qi. Thanks for taking my question. So my question is also related to Newsfeed. I wanted to get a sense, does the 1Q guidance that you provided includes any expectations from the Newsfeed ad contribution? And what is management expectation and target regarding how fast and how big the Newsfeed could achieve in 2017? And also given your comment on shifting to AI and all this content platform, Jennifer, you just mentioned about some spending, just roughly, could you get a sense how much the investment spend that we should expect related to this Newsfeed ad initiative? Thank you.
Jennifer Li, Baidu Inc - CFO [13] Alicia, thank you for the question. For Q1, specifically, Newsfeed is a product that we launched for a few quarters now, and is early stage in monetization. So for Q1 guidance, we do have a small part that is contributing from feed. It will grow over the years, over the quarters into 2017 as we're growing the user base, users' time on it, the advertiser pool. And we expect Newsfeed to add more contributions to our overall revenue contribution. For investment related to Newsfeed, I mentioned earlier, content is one, specifically related to building up the ecosystem and provide rich content and good user experience as our users use the product and engage with our service. For Newsfeed investment, I also mentioned about sales and marketing related expenses. So this is more for user adoption. The investments in AI, particularly are more in the technology side, and that has to do mainly with R&D expenses. And therefore, as I mentioned earlier, we'll continue to invest in R&D steadily but that is more gradual, it's competency build-up, it's talent, but that's not different from the way that we have been approaching R&D investment over the years.
Operator [14] Thank you. Our next question comes from the line of Alex Yao from JPMorgan. Please go ahead.
Alex Yao, JPMorgan - Analyst [15] Hi, good morning everyone. Thank you for taking my question. I have a question on the core search business. The mobile search MAU this quarter, the growth rate slowed down to 2% on year-over-year basis. As you guys mentioned in the past, that search is a traffic-bound business. Now that the mobile search traffic is slowing down and PC is most likely declining, how should we think about search growth outlook for the next two to three years? Thank you.
Robin Li, Baidu Inc - Co-Founder, Chairman and CEO [16] Yes, I think the MAU for mobile search has to slow down because we basically penetrated almost all the Internet users here in China, and the penetration rate, when it's more than 50%, that the growth rate will inevitably slow down. What we are hoping is that we will continue to innovate in search technology to enable people to ask questions or enter queries in more natural ways, such as asking questions in natural language or in the form of voice, or when they take a picture, they can use that picture to search. This will increase the dependency of users to our product. So I think overall that the traffic growth for mobile will slow down, but we think it should be able to continue to grow over the next two to three years.
Operator [17] Thank you. Our next question comes from the line of Juan Lin from 86Research. Please go ahead.
Juan Lin, 86Research - Analyst [18] Hi, good morning, Robin, Jennifer, Dr. Qi Lu and Linda. Thank you for taking my questions. Actually I have one follow-up question on Newsfeed. I'm wondering if you could share with us some metrics in terms of Newsfeed advertising and what is the current pricing policy click-through rate. And what is our strategy to compete for user time spent with our Newsfeed product, particularly in terms of user experience, when competing against market leaders? Thank you.
Robin Li, Baidu Inc - Co-Founder, Chairman and CEO [19] I think we allow users to create designated created for Newsfeed advertisement. Therefore, the advertisers have the power to name their own price. If they don't do that, I mean, when they show the same creative words for both search and Newsfeed, we will typically apply a smart discount to the cost per click on the Newsfeed. So, on average, the click price for Newsfeed is meaningfully lower than that of Search. We're thinking about probably half of the search-related click price. Right now the ad load on our Newsfeed is relatively low, and user experience has been very good, versus our search-related customers, as well as those created-dedicated for Newsfeed.
Operator [20] Right, thank you. Our next question comes from the line of Piyush Mubayi from Goldman Sachs. Please go ahead.
Piyush Mubayi, Goldman Sachs - Analyst [21] Thank you for taking my question. Jennifer, you talked about MAU and GMV being less relevant for gauging success of the business. What would be the relevant metrics you'd look at going forward and could you give us a sense of which ones are the ones that you would share with us going forward. And a question for Robin. Robin, you made a push into software and hardware AI applications, including the acquisition of Raven Technology and the establishment of a few business units. How do you see this evolve? And could you talk about the shape and size of this opportunity? Thank you.
Jennifer Li, Baidu Inc - CFO [22] With regards to the operating metrics, as we mentioned earlier, the mobile transition is pretty much behind us. And our services are very much penetrated into the current Internet population in China. Also, related to Nuomi services, it helps provide service-related content for our search ecosystem, and the GMV won't be a meaningful target objective for us.
